title.value: Detection and Evaluation of bias-inducing Features in Machine learning
title.justification: Title of the paper succinctly represents its focus on bias detection and evaluation techniques in machine learning.
title.quote: Title of the manuscript: Detection and Evaluation of bias-inducing Features in Machine learning

extractions.description: The paper proposes techniques for systematically identifying bias-inducing features in machine learning models. It introduces both single and double feature swapping functions to assess the direct and indirect impacts of features on model predictions. Validation is done using four well-known datasets to demonstrate the utility in developing fairer models.

type.justification: The research involves experimental validation using real datasets and applied models to evaluate their proposed techniques for detecting bias-influencing features.
type.quote: We validated our technique by performing multiple empirical experiments using four well-known datasets to demonstrate the usefulness of our contributions.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on identifying and evaluating bias-inducing features to ensure fairness in machine learning models.
name.quote: Our study is the first step in helping domain experts make an informed decision by following a systematic identification of bias-inducing features.

name.justification: The research incorporates methods to explain the impact of features on the fairness of ML models, related to AI explainability.
name.quote: We showed with the help of the state-of-the-art model explainability tool that the potential bias-inducing features that are less important to the ML model can be removed to improve fairness.

name.justification: Inference techniques and principles were used to identify and understand the impacts of features on model predictions.
name.quote: We propose a novel single feature swapping and double feature swapping functions to help estimate the direct and indirect impact of each feature on the model prediction.

name.justification: The logistic regression model was used to evaluate the effects of feature swapping on prediction fairness.
name.quote: In similar to the Student performance dataset, the rows containing missing values are dropped and correlated features were removed during the preprocessing step. Also, the continuous features were converted to categorical using the feature value partitioning technique in Definition (6) The target variable is a binary class referring to the presence or absence of heart disease in the patient.

is_contributed.justification: Logistic Regression is not a novel contribution in this study but a pre-existing model used for experiments.
is_contributed.quote: Logistic regression model was used in our validation experiments.

is_executed.justification: The logistic regression model must have been executed as part of experiments to evaluate proposed methods.
is_executed.quote: A logistic regression model was fitted against the historical admissions decisions regarding features considered relevant for Harvard’s admission decision to model Harvard’s decision rule above.

is_compared.justification: The focus of the paper is not on comparing logistic regression with other models but rather on evaluating the impact of features on bias.
is_compared.quote: While logistic regression models were used, their comparison against other models wasn't the focus.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This appears to be the fundamental reference book for understanding applications of logistic regression in various domains.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The concepts and applications are grounded on principles detailed in Applied Logistic Regression.

name.justification: SHAP is used to explain the individual predictions and their interpretation concerning model fairness.
name.quote: The importance of the feature is computed by taking the average of the absolute values of the SHAP values for all instances.
